Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment and Bail Hearings as to Jose Babilonia-Torres (1) Count 1-2 held on 6/27/2012. AUSA Justin Martin and AFPD Giovanni Canino were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel had no evidence at this time, but reserved to reopen the matter of bail. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:41. Hearing ended at 02:44. Interpreter Ani Navarro. (br) (Entered: 06/29/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment and Detention Hearings as to Brian Osorio-Padilla (10) Count 1 held on 8/21/2012. AUSA Justin Martin and defense counsel Victor Miranda were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, defense counsel was heard by proffer and moved for defendant to be released on bond. The Government proffered and moved for detention. After counsel met with his client for a moment, counsel withdrew his argument and stated that his client is not moving for bail. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:30. Hearing held at 03:06. Hearing ended at 03:24. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (br) (Entered: 08/24/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment and Detention Hearings as to Orlando Felix-Negron (11) Count 1 held on 8/21/2012. AUSA Justin Martin and defense counsel Mariangela Tirado were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, defense counsel was heard by proffer and believes that there are release conditions that can be tailored by the Court. The Government was heard by proffered and moved for detention. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. Defense counsel requested to reserve the right to reopen the matter of bail once discovery 1s received and reviewed. Reservation was noted by the Court. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:30. Hearing held at 03:06. Hearing ended at 03:24. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (br) (Entered: 08/24/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment and Detention Hearings as to Nelson Alonso-Galarza (12) Count | held on 8/21/2012. AUSA Justin Martin and defense counsel Kendys Pimentel were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, defense counsel proffered that defendant may be placed in home incarceration or home detention due to his mental condition. The Government was heard and moved for detention. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. Although medical notice to MDC was sent, it may be possible that equivalent medication be provided as to his medical condition. Counsel will follow-up as to her client's health condition with MDC. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:30.  Hearing held at 03:24. Hearing ended at 03:37. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (br) (Entered: 08/24/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment and Bail Hearings as to Pedro Hernandez-Sosa (13) Count 1 held on 8/30/2012. AUSA Justin Martin and Manuel E. Moraza-Ortiz, defense counsel were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel was heard by proffer and believes that there are release conditions to be imposed. The Government was heard by proffer and moved for detention. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial due to a pending outstanding arrest warrant in the state court. However, if after counsel receives discovery and reviews the weigh of the evidence, counsel may reopen the matter of bail. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:46. Hearing ended at 03:01. Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (br) Modified on 8/31/2012 adding text (np). (Entered: 08/30/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Detention Hearing as to Alexis Hernandez-Burgos held on 8/30/2012. AUSA Justin Martin and defense counsel Francisco Adams were present. Defense counsel proffered that defendant's aunt is willing to post her property as collateral for bail, that defendant's wife may serve as third party custodian and requested that bond be set. The Government proffered defendant's role and/or participation and moved for detention without bail. After hearing the parties, the Court finds that, although Probation Office recommended bail, the weigh of the evidence is very strong. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:35. Hearing ended at 02:46. Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (br) (Entered: 08/30/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Suppression Hearing as to Irving Melecio-Ramirez held on 5/14/2013. Present: AUSA Justin Martin, defense counsel Juan Milanes and John Kiyonaga. Defendant present U/C and assisted by the court interpreter. AUSA Martin advised the court of the filing of a motion at DE 296 , informing the Court and Defendant that the government does not intent to introduce at trial the cell phones or dated extracted. Defense counsel stated that based on the stipulation, defendant moved to withdraw suppression hearing since the matter of the cell phones is moot. Counsel requested the cell phones to be returned to defendant immediately. The Court granted motion to withdraw and vacated hearing, stipulation is clear on the record. (Court Reporter FTR.) Hearing set for 9:15. Hearing held at 9:44. Hearing ended at 9:47. Interpreter Janis Palma. (amr) (Entered: 05/14/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jose Acevedo- Velez (9) held on 4/30/2014. AUSA Justin Martin and defense counsel Richard Dansoh were present. Defendant was present in court and under custody. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count Two (2) of the Indictment. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jose Babilonia-Torres (1), Irving Melecio-Ramirez (2), Xavier Melecio-Ramirez (3), Victor Real-Alomar (4), Jose Gonzalez-Bernard (5), Felix A. Hernandez-Burgos (6), Alexis Hernandez-Burgos (7) held on 8/17/2018. Present were AUSA Victor Acevedo and defense counsel Hector Chico, Thomas Lincoln, Laura Maldonado, Javier Morales, Jose Novas, Irma Valldejuli and Francisco Adams. The defendants were under custody, present in court and assisted by a Certified Court Interpreter. Consents to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge were filed and accepted in open court. The defendants were found competent to plea. The defendants were advised of the maximum penalties they are facing, their constitutional rights, consequences of waiving their constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Carmen C. Cerezo, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to count one (1) of the Second Superseding Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Attorney Laura Maldonado requested that her client remain in the jurisdiction since he is currently enrolled in two educational courses, psychology class and physical therapy class, and she believes this will be beneficial in the ground of rehabilitation. The Court recommends that the USMS and BOP allow defendant Xavier Melecio-Ramirez to stay in the jurisdiction. Attorney Javier Morales requested that his client remain in the jurisdiction in the grounds that he has not received family visits and also requested an expedited PSI Report. The Court noted the request to stay in the jurisdiction and advised Attorney Javier Ramos to file a motion regarding the expedited PSI Report. Attorney Jose Novas requested that his client remain in the Jurisdiction on medical grounds. The Court noted the request and advised Attorney Jose Novas to file a motion. Attorney Irma Valldejuli informed she will be filing a motion on behalf of her client as to why he should remain in the jurisdiction. Attorneys Thomas Lincoln and Victor Chico requested that their clients remain in the jurisdiction since their clients want to be present in the PSI Interview, also Attorney Thomas Lincoln indicated that his client is enrolled in educational courses. Sentencing Hearing as to Defendants #5 - #7 is set for 11/29/2018 at 1:15 PM, 1:30 PM and 1:45 PM, respectively, in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter DCR / Coutroom 8.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Sentencing held on 12/11/2018 for Jose Babilonia-Torres (1). Present: AUSA Elba Gorbea, Atty. Victor Chico and USPO Michelle Acevedo. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Government's statement was heard. Count(s) 1ss, IMPR: One hundred and fifty-four (154) months and fourteen (14) days, to be served concurrently to the sentences imposed in criminal case numbers CLA2011G0402, CLA2011G0403, CLA2011G0404, CLA2011G0405 and CSC2011G0367. SRT: Three (3) years. No fine. SMA of $100.00. Restitution is deferred until 3/6/2019. The Court granted the United States until 1/8/2019 to obtain information from the victims and inform the Court on the amount of restitution. Defendant may respond by 1/25/2019. Count(s) 2ss, 7ss, 8ss-9ss, Dismissed as requested by the government. (Court Reporter Zulma Ruiz.) Hearing set for 11:30. Hearing held at 11:54. Hearing ended at 12:15. Interpreter Annie Flores. (nat) (Entered: 12/11/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Sentencing held on 12/11/2018 for Victor Real-Alomar (4). Present: AUSA Victor Acevedo, Atty. Javier Morales and USPO Ariana Guzman. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Case was called for Initial on Revocation as to Pedro Hernandez-Sosa (13) on 12/2/2020, but it was not held. Present: AUSA David Henek and AFPD Victor Gonzalez. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. AFPD Gonzalez informed the Court that the defendant requested a continuance of the hearing until a date on which his attorney Alex Rosa would be available to be present for the hearing. The Court noted that it had received notification from counsel Rosa as to his unavailability to appear today due to a prior work commitment in state court. The Court granted the defendant's request and initially continued the hearing for 12/7/2020. However, shortly after the hearing ended, the Court received notification via text message from defense counsel regarding his availability for the hearing on certain dates. Accordingly, Initial Appearance on Revocation Proceedings was CONTINUED until 12/11/2020 10:45 AM in VTC Bridge MDM before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Pedro Hernandez- Sosa (13) held on 12/11/2020. Present: Attorney Alex Rosa on behalf of the defendant. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Benitez at Docket No. 1098 . The defendant was also advised of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. Attorney Rosa explained that he had been retained to represent the defendant in 19-CR-510-4 (SCB) in the Middle District of Florida (Tampa Division) and that he would represent the defendant in these revocation proceedings as well. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Preliminary Revocation Hearing set for 12/18/2020 09:30 AM in VTC Bridge MDM before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan.The Government is reminded that an interpreter must be provided if any of its witnesses cannot testify in the English Language. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Pedro Hernandez-Sosa (13) held on 12/18/2020. Present: AUSA Alexander Alum, defense counsel Alex Rosa and USPO Jose Benitez. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. Attorney Rosa stated that his client would waive his right to a preliminary hearing. The Court accepted the defendant's oral waiver, subject to the subsequent filing of the signed waiver form. The Court found probable cause as to the violation included in the Motion filed by USPO at Docket No. 1098 , pursuant to Rules 5 and 32.1 of the Fed.R.Crim.P. The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Pedro A. Delgado-Hernandez for Final Revocation Hearing. The defendant shall remain detained pending further proceedings. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant[s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. Signed Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form to be filed by the defense within 14 days. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release to be set by the Presiding Judge. (Court Reporter DCR.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 09:35.Hearing ended at 09:51 Interpreter Felix Toledo. (lod) (Entered: 12/31/2020)
